metadata.title: CVE-2020-6821 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: When reading from areas partially or fully outside the source resource withWebGL's copyTexSubImage method, the specification requires thereturned values be zero. Previously, this memory was uninitialized, leadingto potentially sensitive data disclosure. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 68.7.0, Firefox ESR < 68.7, and Firefox < 75. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2 xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
